extracted_rules.rule: Extension of existing side yard encroachment

Qualifiers.Scope: Allowable extensions to existing encroachments of walls into required yards.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to existing walls that encroach into a required interior side yard. The extension is permitted on the ground floor only. This rule applies only to structures that were legally constructed without a variance or a home improvement exception (HIE). The extension may be performed only once in the life of the structure.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Walls that do not meet the minimum setback of 5'-0" from the property line may not be extended. Walls may not be stepped back and then extended. Multiple, non-contiguous protrusions are not permitted. If two existing walls are encroaching, only one of them may be extended.

Variables.existing_wall_setback: The distance of the existing encroaching wall from the interior side property line.
Variables.existing_wall_length: The length of the existing encroaching wall.
Variables.extension_length: The length of the proposed extension.

Conditions.Mandatory: The existing wall must be at least 5'-0" from the property line. The extension must be at the same setback as the existing wall. The extension must be contiguous with the existing protrusion. The original non-complying wall must be retained.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: The length of the extension must be equal to or less than the lesser of two values: the length of the existing wall OR 20'-0".

Exceptions.special_setbacks: Exceptions apply to special setbacks as well. (Ambiguous Flag: The text does not define 'special setbacks' or the nature of the 'exceptions' that apply to them.)

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case (Section A) under the general regulation 'Allowable extensions to existing encroachments'.
Relationships.Cross-references: This rule is subject to the general conditions listed in the 'Note' section of the source text. It depends on the externally defined 'required interior side yard setback'.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: If multiple side yard walls encroach, the choice to extend one precludes the extension of any others.

extracted_rules.rule: Extension of existing front yard encroachment

Qualifiers.Scope: Allowable extensions to existing encroachments of walls into required yards.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to existing walls that encroach into a required front yard. The extension is permitted on the ground floor only. This rule applies only to structures that were legally constructed without a variance or a home improvement exception (HIE). The extension may be performed only once in the life of the structure.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Walls that do not meet the minimum setback of 14'-0" from the property line may not be extended. Walls may not be stepped back and then extended. Multiple, non-contiguous protrusions are not permitted.

Variables.existing_wall_setback: The distance of the existing encroaching wall from the front property line.
Variables.existing_encroaching_wall_length: The length of the existing encroaching wall.
Variables.extension_length: The length of the proposed extension.
Variables.combined_length: The sum of the existing encroaching wall length and the extension length.
Variables.max_house_width: The maximum width of the house. (Ambiguous Flag: The method for measuring 'maximum width' is not specified.)

Conditions.Mandatory: The existing wall must be at least 14'-0" from the property line. The extension must be at the same setback as the existing wall. The extension must be contiguous with the existing protrusion. The original non-complying wall must be retained. Both of the following provisions must be met: 1) the length of the extension is no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall, AND 2) the combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: An extension is permitted only if (extension_length <= existing_encroaching_wall_length) AND (combined_length <= 0.5 * max_house_width).

Exceptions.special_setbacks: Exceptions apply to special setbacks as well. (Ambiguous Flag: The text does not define 'special setbacks' or the nature of the 'exceptions' that apply to them.)

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case (Section B) under the general regulation 'Allowable extensions to existing encroachments'.
Relationships.Cross-references: This rule is subject to the general conditions listed in the 'Note' section of the source text. It depends on the externally defined 'required front yard setback'.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: The two provisions for extension length and combined length are co-dependent and must both be satisfied (AND logic).

extracted_rules.rule: Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment

Qualifiers.Scope: Allowable extensions to existing encroachments of walls into required yards.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to existing walls that encroach into a required street side yard. The extension is permitted on the ground floor only. This rule applies only to structures that were legally constructed without a variance or a home improvement exception (HIE). The extension may be performed only once in the life of the structure.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Walls that do not meet the minimum setback of 10'-0" from the property line may not be extended. Walls may not be stepped back and then extended. Multiple, non-contiguous protrusions are not permitted.

Variables.existing_wall_setback: The distance of the existing encroaching wall from the street side property line.
Variables.existing_wall_length: The length of the existing encroaching wall.
Variables.extension_length: The length of the proposed extension.

Conditions.Mandatory: The existing wall must be at least 10'-0" from the property line. The extension must be at the same setback as the existing wall. The extension must be contiguous with the existing protrusion. The original non-complying wall must be retained.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: The length of the extension must be equal to or less than the lesser of two values: the length of the existing wall OR 20'-0".

Exceptions.special_setbacks: Exceptions apply to special setbacks as well. (Ambiguous Flag: The text does not define 'special setbacks' or the nature of the 'exceptions' that apply to them.)

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case (Section C) under the general regulation 'Allowable extensions to existing encroachments'.
Relationships.Cross-references: This rule is subject to the general conditions listed in the 'Note' section of the source text. It depends on the externally defined 'required street side yard setback'.
